trustfund: TF025050-JAPANESE GRANT FOR THE ENVIRONMENT,TF022985-SIDA CTF FOR ENVIRONMENT-MARINE ENVIRON.,TF033924-KENYA - WATER SUPPLY PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Mombasa and Coastal Water
            Supply Engineering and Rehabilitation Project is rated as
            unsatisfactory. The Project did not improve National Water
            Conservation and Pipeline Corporation's (NWCPC's)
            commercial and financial performance. Although the Project
            did satisfactorily complete technical pre-investment studies
            and did initiate corresponding environmental impact
            assessments and mitigation plans, it did not pay attention
            to two of the prerequisites for follow-up activities, i.e.,
            the financial credibility of the water utility and the
            affordability of an improved services. Main lessons learned
            include: a) the water utility company implementing the
            project should be financially viable; b) detailed project
            preparation should be undertaken before appraisal; and c)
            introduction of new components in the project description
            may result in unforeseen cost overruns.
